summary_comment: Zach is highly regarded as an excellent professor at OSU, known for his engaging lectures and strong commitment to student success. His classes are challenging and require significant time and effort, particularly for the lab component, but students find his support and care valuable. While the workload is substantial, many appreciate the clarity of expectations and fair grading.

Ratings.comment: Zach is awesome! One of my favorite professors at OSU. Beware that 5350.02 is insanely time-consuming (I put less time into OChem). You have to attend open labs throughout the week in addition to lectures and labs if you want to pass. Zach and the TAs are super helpful and easy to talk to. This was my favorite class I've taken in my 4 years here.

zach is the best professor i have had at OSU. the class is not easy, but if you show up to lectures and put in the work studying you will do well. he really cares about the students and their success, and is in charge of the lab which means you get to know him well. the textbook was recommended but i did not use it because lectures were enough.

Great, engaging lectures that are worth your time. However, I felt I put in significantly more work for this 3-credit class than I have any other 5000-level class; I would not recommend taking this class with an 18/hr schedule. Lots of assignments, but expectations are clear and grading is fair.

He is a very nice guy and responds quickly. This class just had a bunch of work. A bunch of lecture videos that you NEED to take notes on. If not, you won't know anything for the exams. Exams mean a lot towards your grade. Research project at the end, which actually isn't too terrible. Overall it wasn't a bad class, there's just a lot too it.

I took this course over the summer at Stone Lab, so it may be different from main campus, but Taxonomy of Inverts was a very fun course, and I'd highly recommend taking it at Stone Lab if you can. The class was a lot of studying, but it was also one of the most enjoyable classes I've taken. Zach is funny and always open to help if you need it.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is generally poor, with students citing unclear directions, ineffective lecture methods, and an unhelpful approach to answering questions. Many find her lectures unengaging and her teaching style unsuitable for helping students succeed in the course.

Ratings.comment: I don't know if the course was poorly designed, or if I got a terrible lecturer, but I learned very little from this course. What work I did complete was not constructive. Directions were not specific in assignments, and lectures were just PowerPoint slides being read out loud.

She means well, but doesn't know what students need to succeed. She does problems in class, but doesn't explain, and when students ask questions, she'll say it's surprising the student doesn't get it. She's said that she doesn't like teaching this class. I would've dropped and taken another, but it's major-required, and she's the only prof.

Dr. Castillas was a great prof, but that class itself just goes from 0-100 quickly, so there isn't a whole lot of time for her to review everything. Theres always extra credit on exams, and lowest of each assignment type gets dropped.

This class had 3% of the grade as attendance and losing that 3% is so much more rewarding than having to see this professor every week. She is argumentative, uncooperative, and enjoys humiliating students for wrong answers after not teaching the content clearly. This professor makes little to no effort to educate her students, do not take.

She was just a poor lecturer. She did not convey the information in a digestible or helpful fashion. She taught somewhat outdated and impractical ways of calculating/determining things, and just made the material unnecessarily tedious and difficult! The class content is really not difficult at all, but she finds a way to make it so!

summary_comment: Professor Matt is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous lectures, making the class enjoyable despite its fast pace and heavy reading requirements. Students appreciate his hands-on approach, particularly the outdoor restoration projects, and his genuine care for their understanding and success. However, his grading can be challenging due to vague instructions and strict criteria.

Ratings.comment: The class overall was very easy if you just attend class (which is mandatory). However I have found him to be a very tough grader. The instructions are vague, sometimes only said verbally in class, and it felt like if you did not get every single detail right your grade on the assignments would suffer severely. Keep this in mind when taking him.
I love Matt!!

I am sad to be graduating because I'll be leaving Matt. I had him my first semester at OSU, and I had him during my last one. He is so precious, witty, and knowledgeable about restoration. His passion for the subject makes me know I made the right decision. He hates online classes but he still made them fun with his weekly "cheeky" themes.

Absolute gem of a professor. From his witty European humor to his boundless knowledge of all things environmental science, you wont be disappointed! Definitely read the scientific papers on time or you will fall behind quickly. Class moves fast and is mainly group project based but I made a ton of friends and had great discussions with my peers.

One of my favorite professors by far, he knows his stuff and truly cares that we understand the content. Reading is super important in this class, but keep up and engage in discussions and you'll do great.

Matt designed this course and its AWESOME. Every Friday we went outside and worked on a class restoration project on campus. Need to show up to class or you won't get credit. Made tons of friends and learned many useful hands on skills such as how to use a chainsaw, pesticides, properly plant trees, install erosion barriers, etc. GREAT class.

Matt is the best lecturer I have EVER had. He is hilarious and very knowledgeable. The class is discussion based, you were expected to watch the lecture video and read the assigned scientific paper before class (2 classes per week, but only one topic/paper for the week). He really cares about his students as well and wants everyone to succeed.

summary_comment: Professor Bullock is highly regarded for her caring and fair approach, extensive knowledge in environmental social science, and engaging teaching style. She simplifies complex topics while keeping the material intellectually stimulating. However, while the exams align closely with lecture content and the grading process for the final paper lacks detailed feedback, students find the homework easy and not heavily weighted.

Ratings.comment: Professor Bullock is an extremely caring and fair professor. She is very knowledgeable about environmental social science and is fun to listen to and engage with in class. She is encouraging and makes the course very simple and straightforward, yet fun and intellectually stimulating.

The exams were fine, everything on it was in the lectures. There was easy homework but it wasn't worth many points. The final paper doesn't have a rubric, just directions. You submit both a draft and a final paper. No feedback to help improve by her, we only had other students to go off of. Doesn't explain why you were graded bad or give back exams

summary_comment: Dr. Schwartz is described as a highly engaging and sweet professor who builds strong rapport with students. While his lectures can be dull and his exams challenging, he is known for curving grades generously. Despite the difficulty, students appreciate his passion for the subject and find his humor entertaining.

Ratings.comment: This rating is for 5203, but there was no option for that! I had a GREAT experience with Dr. Schwartz. I'm shocked by the low ratings here, maybe they're outdated? He is so sweet, and I was able to build a great rapport with him. Material was straightforward, exams are tricky but he curves a lot. He is kind and incredible! Love him.

I liked Prof Schwartz a lot. He's a funny guy and is entertaining. However, lectures can get a bit dull. The exams haven't been too bad; he curves them and they're straight from the lectures and assignments.

So the professor is super sweet and is actually sad when kids don't come. However his tests will bone you. The whole class is curved but you need to study hard af for tests. Also he makes obscure references to movies, writers, and singers that are on the tests too.

Class was okay, though boring to the point you'll probably fall asleep at some point. He lectures the entire class time. You don't need to go to class, however; there are a few occasions in which he leaves the online notes blank and you'll only know the answers if you go to class. HW very easy, he only grades to see if you did it. Exams not too bad
No textbook, short online assignments with easy readings
Interesting guy, but very hard exams for a general educations entry level class. Loves his subject and he is pretty funny!

summary_comment: Dr. Wyatt is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, creating a positive and welcoming classroom environment that encourages student engagement. He is an effective lecturer who genuinely cares about his students' success, employing interactive methods to cater to diverse learning styles.

Ratings.comment: I really enjoyed taking this class with Dr. Wyatt and would recommend it to anyone. He created a very positive and welcoming learning environment where you enjoyed coming to class.

Dr. Wyatt is a fantastic lecturer and he genuinely cares about the success of his students. His lectures are interactive and has several ways to instill the knowledge into different types of learners.

summary_comment: Professor Lower offers an organized and manageable course, particularly suitable for balancing with other coursework. Lectures are clear and accessible, and the use of retakes on quizzes makes the material approachable. While the class is generally easy and can lead to a straightforward "A," some students find the lectures dry and the content overly focused on practical applications rather than deep theoretical understanding.

Ratings.comment: A nice class to take to boost your GPA. As a CSE major. This class was very easy to balance with other coursework.
Took ENR2100 online and his lectures were great! It was easy to reach out to him with questions and it's clear he wants his students to succeed.

Professor Lower keeps things organized, with weekly quizzes you can retake. The content is interesting, and unstuck study was a helpful study tool alongside the lectures. Definitely an easy A if you stay on top of it.

Dr. Lower kept the online class extremely organized. He was easily accessible for help. The quizzes allowed you two tries, taking the best score. There we no exams rather multiple and a final project exam. Overall, the content was interesting and applicable to the real world.

Let me start out by saying the course design was great! Finally a professor who doesn't utilize discussion posts for every...single...thing. However the professor himself, though he can be nice, is not very accommodating if you are going through a hard time. Overall course was cool, overall the professor could use some empathy.

Dr. Lower was a fair professor. Quizzes were not too bad, sometimes there was a question or two that was tricky. You got two tries for each quiz and Dr. Lower drops the two lowest scores. There is a final project at the end of the semester, but as long as you do the work prior, it's not too bad. The lecture videos were not long.

Really boring but very easy class with very dry and long lectures. There's a poster project, I'd recommend just taking a safe and easy topic to make sure you can easily fulfill the grading criteria rather than doing something niche that you're personally into. Each quiz gets 2 tries and you can just skim the lecture videos as you take them.
Super easy class. All answers to quizzes are online. You are allowed to use GPT as well, making this course max an hour per week of work. Super easy A.
Pretty easy class. Just consisted of a lecture and a quiz due each week. In addition, a few other more in depth assignments for the semester. Definitely would take again.

This man was passionate about the environment, but had the most boring voice. I struggled to watch through entire lectures. For an introductory course, he expects too much commitment and expects us to spend double digit hours on research. He treated every student as if they were an ENR major, when in reality the class was only for gen - ed

The lecture videos don't cover everything in the slides (doesn't show all of them). Only interaction you would have with him is on the Q&A discussion board. He does respond in a timely manner, as do the TA's on emails. The class is big but the grades were so slow. We had 2(?) days from receiving feedback on our poster draft for the final pres.

Dr. Lower was extremely empathetic and nice. The assignments were only one a week and they are usually straightforward and easy. All exams were open book and the final project was gradual and completely manageable. The lectures were clear and comprehensible, but in no way mandatory. Would definitely take a class with him again.

Dr. Lower is one of my favorite professors. He truly wants the best for his students and is passionate about the material. He is great at communication and what he expects from you. I loved his class and would absolutely recommend him.
Professor Lower is so nice and very passionate about the Earth. His lectures can be boring but the work is very easy. He is very approachable and cares about his students.

Took this class online with around 500 people. The lecture videos were fairly boring but the assignments were graded for participation or had clear rubrics. You work on the final scientific poster the whole semester and it can be difficult at times, but Dr. Lower was available to help and answered emails quickly. Exams were somewhat difficult.

I took the asynchronous section of this course so I can't say I had direct contact with Dr. Lower himself, but the grading was clear and the class was easy. Poster project can be a bit of work and the lectures can get boring, however.

No one really cares about the environment. This class was a waste of time and the poster project was a waste of time. They actually think your future employer will make you do a poster. 70% of the exam questions are true and false questions and answers are not easily found in the lectures.

Dr. Lower clearly has a passion for environmental science that comes out in his lectures. The poster project that I completed in 2100 was one of my favorite projects I've ever done - if you like picking your own topic and researching, take this class. Exams worth 50% but all open note.
The grading system is odd. So make sure to really complete all your assignments.
He is a great guy and wants everyone to do well. Don't hesitate to reach out to him because he is really understanding and flexible.

Quizzes are open book, open note, open internet. Lecture slides are easily available. The poster assignment that you work on throughout the semester is graded a lot harder than other things in the class. Not a bad class to take though.
Very well organized class and easy to understand material. Dr. Lower was very accommodating all year and gives you plenty of chances to succeed. Highly recommend!

Overall it was a very easy class. You have usually one thing to due a week. The midterm and final are open note and there is around 10 bonus points for each of them. There is a large course project that you have to complete that's worth a good chunk of your grade it's not too hard but don't procrastinate.
Made the class simple. Good guy
Really does everything he can to make the class doable for everyone. Very helpful and well set up online class.

Eh. I love environmental science, I'm an EEDS major, and this prof really disappointed me. The assignments felt clunky and in many cases not based on lecture material, the lectures were incredibly boring, and prof was unhelpful and arrogant. Easy A, just don't expect him to be caring or thoughtful.

The class was fully asynchronous. The main components of my grade were a project and the midterm/final. If you put the work into the project, you should get a good grade. The midterm and final are open notes. He gave a lot of extra credit. I ended with over a 100.

The lectures were not particularly interesting, but the tests were open note and pretty easy. Plus, there was ample extra credit if you turned assignments in on time. The most difficult part of the class was a poster assignment that took some time, but people mostly hated it because they did not expect any work in the class. It was not very hard.
Great professor, easy class with a bit of work. If you give minimal effort you will surely do well in this class.

This class was super easy. I would not recommend watching the pre-recorded lectures though, they're pretty boring and you don't need them to get a good grade. there's only one big project but if you stay on top of it during the semester you'll be fine
Great online class. Do all of the assignments and you'll get an A. Easy turn-in process and accepts late submissions. Plus a TON of extra credit opportunities if you are falling behind.

What a horrible professor. They changed they class layout from previous years and added more assignments that arent intro course friendly. If you have any questions at all be prepared for belittlement. Our entire class was struggling on practically every assignment, messaging each other on our confusion of the assignments. Dont take this class.

Highly recommend taking this class with Dr. Lower. He is phenomenal teacher and the workload is not bad at all. You get 2 attempts on each quiz, and on the midterm and final. One big poster project that you work on throughout the semester that is very manageable
Easy course. Straight to the point. No asking for extra thoughts or all that. Just pure science.
All I got to say is easy GE A!
great prof overall IF youre not lazy and willing to spend the allotted time on your poster assignment and lecture vids. theres extra credit... you will pass if you just TRY. even barely.

Video lectures are a bit boring, use 1.25 speed, but they cover most of what is on the exam (minus a couple Qs). The poster assignment was broken into 6 parts, all graded fairly, though they can be time consuming at first. There were 4 quizzes which are easy and the exams are open note/google allowed. Lots of EC and the TAs are really helpful.

Dr. Lower was extremely condescending and rude when I tried to ask for help outside of class. His class is mainly focused on the poster project. The quizzes are fairly simple, but they do not have anything to do with the lectures. Finals are a weird mix of random information that was quickly covered in lectures.

We have lectures each week, 10 really easy quizzes, and one big project (that is a lot of work). The final/midterm doesn't really relate to lectures and asks a lot of random questions, but we were allowed to use Google. He does give you lots of bonus points. Brian is very condescending in his email responses and makes you feel stupid.

Dr. Lower is very reachable, he often responds to emails in under 30 minutes. My issue with his course online is that the midterm and final had nothing to do with class content and were very difficult. Although difficult, they are open note so you can do well without knowing much. Overall, U wouldnt recommend it. Way too much work for a GE.

There is a semester long poster project which is fun AS LONG as you choose a topic you're interested in. This is an easy class, except for the midterm and the final. The questions are completely unrelated to the lecture videos. They are open note, you can google things etc, but they are still very, very hard. Him and the TAs respond to emails ASAP.

This class was online and asynchronous, so I cant say much about Lower as a person, but he explains things pretty well in video lectures, although they could get pretty boring. He gives a lot of extra credit which is nice, although you definitely need it because the quizzes and exams are over the most specific minute details of the course.

The class really is not exciting unless you love enviro science. But he gives so much extra credit that unless you have two brain cells firing, it would be hard to not get at least a B. The poster assignment is probably the most time consuming aspect but it is broken up into sections. Overall a 7/10 class and a 9/10 teacher.

The prerecorded lectures are relatively boring unless youre really into Environmental Science (like I was). However, the poster project will teach you a lot if you actually put a little effort into it. He clearly wants students to do well, and gives a lot of extra credit. Overall, Id recommend him!

I suffered a concussion during the semester when taking Prof. Lower's class. He was easily the kindest and most helpful professor I had when it came to extensions on assignments and exams. The lectures can get boring pretty quickly, but watching them online rather than in person probably doesn't help that.

I took this online class after a friend told me it was easy. It's hard to concentrate watching hours worth of pre-recorded lectures (I'm sure it is much more bearable in person according to other ratings). That being said, the exams were difficult, but the class really revolves around a semester-long project; it's not the worst, but time-consuming.

Dr. Lowel is a great professor. I am not sure how this class was previously taught before going online but the class is greatly structured. Dr. Lowel makes the effort to give weekly explanations of every module. Has TONS of extra credit opportunities and his lecture slides have all the info needed to succeed.

Easy A. Didn't even listen to lecture videos. I just went through the slides several times before exams got high scores on them which are open book. The paper homework is a little bit time-consuming, but it really broadened my view and taught me a lot. There are a Bunch of extra credits so if you study normally, not even hard, you should get an A.

I really enjoyed this class! Lectures could get boring, but there was usually in-class extra credit. The midterm was harder than I expected, but I got a C & a B on the final and still ended the class with an A. The quizzes are super easy, as well as open note/book like the exams. Poster project requires extra work but very possible to get a 100%

A very dry lecturer and hard to pay attention in class. The poster you have to complete is time-consuming and a pain in the butt to complete. The midterm and final are challenging and the average is around a C. However, he offers a ton of extra credit which makes up for this.
The quizzes and test were online but it was still hard.

The biggest grades are 2 exams and a poster project. They are all incredibly easy, just take some time and reading. His lectures are pretty dry and repetitive. I personally wouldn't take it if I didn't have to. It's easy, and exams are open book. Again, boring but easy.

I really liked taking this class. As long as you turned in all of the homework, it is very easy to get an A. The assignments were also explained thoroughly so it was easy to find out what you had to do for each one.

I strongly regret taking his class. He is a tough grader and expects too much from his students when most of us don't understand what is going on. The exams are extremely hard and drop your grade down a significant amount even though we all studied the study guide, which was nothing like the exam. The extra credit does not help and project awful
THE TESTS DO NOT CORRESPOND WITH ANY OF THE MATERIALS GIVEN FOR CLASS. EXPECTS STUDENTS TO PRODUCE ORIGINAL FIGURES FOR SCIENTIFIC STUDIES THEY DID NOT CONDUCT IN A GE COURSE

Midterm was 25% of the final grade for this online class, and it was extremely difficult and unlike any of the study materials. Extra credit barely made a difference, and this professor is not empathetic to difficulties submitting an assignment. My exam timed out and he gave no opportunity to make it up or get points back for technical difficulties

Does not hold office hours and instead relies on his undergraduate T.A.s to grade papers and provide extra help. Tough poster assignment and hard quizzes/exams constitute most of one's grade. Extremely difficult introductory course as the poster assignment requires original figures and scientific methods knowledge.

Dr. Lower's lectures are very good with detailed explanations that are simple to understand. You also can get extra credit for attending. The class does have some assignments (ScienceBite Article) that will require you to put effort in though, but the TAs, offer great feedback. Plus, the class material is engaging as well.

Lecture attendance isn't required, but it was nice to get bonus points for attending. The material was easy but interesting. If you are pursuing ENR, I would take it with a different professor that gives more of a challenge or goes more in depth. The only aspect of the class I didn't enjoy was the ScienceBite article which was a bit time-consuming.

ENR2100 is a solid choice for a GE. Everything is open note and online. Classes are huge but all notes, lectures, etc are online and available. It is very easy to get in touch with the TA/Dr Lower. Also gives bonus points if you actually show up because its technically not necessary
didn't teach much and struggled to stay focused, very nice guy but not a very good professor

Didn't attend class once but still received an A. The class wasn't worth my time because he couldn't focus on the slides and I basically learned nothing. The exams are all open note/book/internet so no complaints there BUT if you are genuinely looking to learn more about the environment, don't take the class with this professor.
This is my first time feeling the need to rate a professor, if that tells you anything.

He gives extra credit almost every class! The rest of the class relies on lecture and videos. Sometimes it gets a little boring, but he is obviously very passionate about what he teaches. Hes hilarious and always willing to help in case of a problem. The ScienceBite is crucial for your grade, but he helps you a lot with that!
A great professor. He is very clear with what is expected in the class and gives you all the tools to earn an A. One paper and two midterms that are not cumulative. Great class

This class was very easy. It's lecture based, but he posts them online. Any tests are taken online before 11:59 PM (open-note). There's a final poster project that's due throughout the semester (Figures, Bibliography, Outline, Etc.). The only assignments besides that are a few NOVA videos with a quiz afterwards. Dr. Lower is funny and insightful.

Very manageable class. There is very little homework other than a possible quiz or an addition to the poster project. The midterm and final are both online and open book. You can also get extra credit for attending on certain days. The poster symposium is very stress-free. Dr. Lower is also pretty funny and adds a lot of context to his lectures.

He seems like a good teacher & most of my complaints are me-specific things. Online classes just aren't for me. Other than that, he's available and has everything up and running for students to take advantage of. One thing I'll say is that the midterm and final are kind of silly and hyper-specific b/c it's open book.

A very well-organized professor and class. There's an insane amount of opportunities to get extra credit even in the online section. Other than quizzes, the only big assignment is a research poster that you work on throughout the semester, but it's split into chunks and very manageable.
great class, easy going professor, I learned a lot of really cool things, all lecture materials are provided for all classes including some notes, recommend this class to everyone!

There are plenty of opportunities for extra credit, but he has no care for his students. The lectures barely correspond with the tests and youre stuck looking up answers on the internet for obscure bits of information he mentioned once but never said again. Its an easy A if you come to class and have perfect memory of every minuscule bit of info
Literally, this man goes out of his way to make sure you pass this class with an A he gives extra credit out the wazoo if you want an easy A this is the class and professor for you

Dr. Lower is the best professor I have had at OSU. His class is extremely well organized, and the lectures are interesting. He wants his students to succeed, so he has a lot of extra credit opportunities to help boost your grade. In the class you'll have to write a short scientific article (done in part), take two exams and 5 quizzes.

Dr. Lower is an awesome professor. He makes the class very easy and if you show up to lecture, you should get an A with all the extra credit he offers. There is little homework to do but there is one project throughout the semester.

Dr. Lower is super nice and his class is incredibly easy. I did not go to one lecture and I ended the course with a B. If you go to lecture, tons of extra credit is offered (I mean like every single day). Do the assignments, check the carmen announcement every week, and you'll be more than fine.

Lower says its online optional but you really should go to class. Youll get extra credit if you go and the final and midterm wont be as difficult since youve seen the info before. Dont just jump into the midterm and final without skimming the slides first.

Dr. Lower is a great professor. He gives out tons of extra credits for almost every course to boost up our grades for midterm and final exams. The exams are hard, but after the extra credits he provided, they go up at least one letter grade. He is caring and nice to all students.

The lectures may be boring for non science majors but he tries to make them interesting. Lecture slides and study guides are posted so class isn't mandatory to pass but he gives extra credit almost every class that gets added to the midterm/final and its worth it.. his test are HARD. semester long project/quizzes can be time consuming but easy.
Really had to work my butt off for my A. The whole course changed. Big poster project and the lectures are very lengthy and heavy. The midterm and final exam are NO JOKE. STUDY.

Academically, this class was a bit of a joke. Lower hands out extra credit like Oprah, and the homework assignments (online quizzes and a couple of small assignments) are a piece of cake. You get multiple attempts on the quizzes. The only somewhat tough part was the final poster, but he gives you a ton of time to work on it. Dr. Lower was great!

Dr. Lower is a great professor who clearly has a passion for environmental science. Class was always interesting and extra credit was offered frequently. The midterm and final were tricky, but understandably so considering they were open-note. The poster project was very enjoyable. You get out of this class what you put into it. Would recommend!!

He's super nice and really wants you to do well. Gives a TON of extra credit. Pretty interesting material and you can tell he's passionate about the subject. Show up to the lectures and you will get extra credit. Midterm and Final online and open note. Quizzes are pretty easy and you have multiple attempts. Great for an easy science credit!

Took the class online, but Dr. Lower was still very communicativecessible to all his online students. He is so understanding & helpful. Online, we took weekly quizzes (2 attempts, easy As) & 2 exams (kinda tough, but open-note & given a lot of time. Do take notes and study to do well on them). Poster project was kinda tough, but TAs were helpful

He is kind and caring! Extra credits are given for attendance. Quizzes are not hard to get full points if you read and watch those given materials. No textbook is needed! His slides are clear and informative! Definitely will take again!

Lectures never took the full time and were very interesting. He cares a lot about the environment and educating us about it. A great prof who understands we are not all science majors, the final paper took time but was doable. Midterms were a little tricky but were open note, much extra credit was offered throughout the course. Easy A!

He is understanding that students have a life outside of class. His lectures are fun and enjoyable. He really makes you care about the subject. He hands out a lot of extra credit just for going to lecture on Fridays. He puts everything up on Carmen right away. There's only the one big poster project and tests and quizzes are all online.

Simply put: Dr. Lower is the man and you need to take him. Easy class, clearly enjoys what he does, and wants you to do well. Pretty much everything is online, do average on the midterms, write the paper on time, show up to class every so often for the extra credit and you will get an A. Unlike most professors, he wants you to get an A.

Dr. Lower acknowledges that most people are just taking this class for the GE credit, so he makes the class entirely manageable. As long as you do the work and follow the grading instructions its an easy A. Only one paper, a few online quizzes, a midterm, and a final (all open notes). He gives out a lot of ec if you come to class

Great professor who really care about our grades! Just a few online quizzes and a paper except the midterm and final. All the quizzes and tests are online and you can use your notes during the test! Lots of extra credit if you come to the class! Overall, he is an excellent professor and you will get an A if you take some time to write the paper.

Lots of extra points given. Only negative I would say is that midterms are harder than he makes them out to be, so study for that. Other than that, barely any work required. He's so funny, definitely a good GE.

Brian Lower acknowledges that most students will not show up to class, so he rewards those who do with quiz answers and lots of extra credit. Really good guy, and his lectures are actually really interesting. I didn't go to every class, but I enjoyed the ones i went to because he delivers the material in a way that makes you want to learn.

Dr Lower cares about his students success, and knows that many of the people taking his class are not scientists. Weekly quizzes but you are given two attempts to take it. No papers except for an article you work on throughout the semester. Attendance is not mandatory but extra credit is given when you do. Would highly recommend his class!

He is such a funny guy and a great professor! He gives out extra credit all the time so you should go to the lectures. He usually ends class early too. There's one project you have to do but it's not very hard. The quizzes and exams are online and open note. They are kind of difficult, but not that bad. If you go to class, you're going to pass.

Great professor. He made a subject that I didn't care about interesting to me. A large portion of your grade is off of one easy semester-long project. I would definitely recommend this class if you need a natural science credit.

He's very knowledgeable about the subject matter he teaches,  very straight forward about his expectations, tailors his lectures to current events, & the things you learn in this class are important for everyday life. There is a ton of extra credit opportunities offered and take advantage of them all because the exams are VERY hard. Easy A overall

Great class, took it 8 weeks over the summer.  Clear grading, easy to follow, you need to watch all the class lecture videos to do well.  A lot of work for 8 weeks but manageable if you stay on top of everything.  Study guides for exams really helped.
Worst professor ever. I have to write about 3000 words for a single homework, which is assigned every week?? and one quiz per week??

Great professor. He clearly loves what he teaches and wants students to love it as well. Offers plenty of extra credit, so it's easy to focus on learning the material for your own education rather than stressing about grades. Exams are much harder than the rest of the class would seem to indicate, but not too bad if you go to class and do the work.

Dr. Lower is great. He's passionate about the course. He really wants students to succeed, shown by the 9.5% extra credit available and how he uses real videos/articles to supplement his lectures. Online midterm and final, as well as online quizzes and a poster project. Textbook is optional. Going to most of his lectures is necessary to do well.

Online weekly quizzes easy, extra credit offered in class (must be there to get it). Project not too difficult, but annoying to present. Online exams are ridiculously hard compared to study guide and lectures. Makes it seem like exams will be basic, but they ask crazy specific details. Need to pay attention in class to do well. Accessible.

Dr. Lower is the best! The midterm and final are online and open note. There's one research paper but it's not bad at all. There are a few online quizzes that are also open note and easy. He's a really good teacher and super friendly and funny. His lectures are informative, and you don't need the textbook. I would definitely take his class again.

Dr. Lower has been one of my favorite professors so far at OSU! He is extremely knowledgeable of the subject matter and makes his lectures interesting incorporating lots of video clips and his own personal stories. If you go to class you DON'T need to by the book! Also gives out a lot of extra credit! Easy A!  Would highly recommend!
Very clear grading. Don't have to buy the book.

His ENR2100 class was an easy one to take to fill a GE requirement. Tests and quizzes are all online and you have two attempts to complete quizzes if you don't do well the first time. If you do watch the lectures and pay marginal attention to them, tests are easy. One major writing project but it's mostly graded on completion. Lots of extra credit.

Prof. Lower is just an amazing guy. He actively accepts that people only take his class to fulfill the GE, but hopes to teach something in the process. Honestly, I came to lectures even though you could totally skip them all. Partially because he offers a TON of EC for just showing up, but his lectures are genuinely interesting. TAKE THIS COURSE!
A lot extra credits

Super chill dude. Relaxed lectures. You don't have to go but you get extra credit if you do.  All the tests and quizzes are online outside of class.  Have to write one thousand word paper over the semester and only two tests. 10/10 would recommend for a GE class
Dr. Lower is a great prof. His lectures can get borings at parts, but this is an easy A class for a GE. If you need a GE class pick this one with Brian Lower-you won't regret it.
A ton of extra credit. Easy grading on the research paper. A lot of interesting information and subjects.

Dr. Lower is a great professor. The class itself is easy for those with prior knowledge, but even those without will do well as long as you attend class. Extra credit is random, but easy, and the paper assignment is easy. Midterm and Final are the easiest I've ever taken here.

This class is really cool and fun. He talks about a lot of relevant issues and that's pretty awesome. Go to class, even though it really isn't mandatory, he ALWAYS gives out extra credit, and 10% extra cred on your final grade can mean a lot. Plus, it really helps on the midterm (where I heard people didn't do well).

This class is very interesting. I show up to class and listen to his lectures and that is all you need. You will learn interesting things, get extra credit "A LOT of it" and be prepared for the exams. Scientific paper was easy. I do recommend you go to class. I was taking a lot of difficult classes and managed to get A- by always attending class.

Dr. Lower is THE MAN! He made class fun and interesting with videos and graphs. There is so much extra credit during the semester too that it's almost impossible to fail this class. I learned a ton from him and I would definitely recommend this class.

Never seen a teacher give so much extra credit. Finished with a 90 but got over 98% w/ extra credit. Often gives bonus points for the "question of the day" in class (which he gives answer to) so you can probably skip as long as you have friend to let you know the answer. Spends first half hour of every class talking about poster that's pretty easy

Dr Lower gives a lot of attendance extra credit, so come to class even if you don't pay attention. The poster project is a guaranteed 95% or higher if you do it.  I would say this is an easy A class if it weren't for the quizzes/exams. They're  online and open note, but the questions are tough.  It also doesn't tell you which ones you got wrong.

Really helpful and funny  professor. Lectures were really interesting and although not mandatory, extra credit is regularly given out for those who attend lecture. Grading is also rather lenient. I thought I was going to get around a 90 in the class, and somehow came out with a 98. I would recommend this class for a GE.
I'd recommend this class to everyone!  Awesome!
Brian Lower is the best professor I have ever had. He will do everything in his power to make you succeed. If you need a science credit, take him! If you go to class you will get an A.
Willing to help students and is passionate about what he teaches. Wants students to succeed and take away something from the class.

Brian is a great professor. He leaves all the tools to get an A online, but will reward you with extra credit for coming to the lectures. You can tell he really cares about what he's teaching and he cares about his students. As long as you complete everything for this class it should be an easy A.
Great GE Science. Easy A if you just do the requirements and extra credit options.

His class really makes me care more about environmental issues. Lectures are very organized. He is very clear about the grading criteria, so as long as you follow the instructions you'll receive good grades on your assignments. And not to mention, go to lectures and you'll get tons of extra credits!

Awesome professor with an very rare gift for teaching college students.  He's not like most science profs who show up to class because because the university makes them.  Gives A LOT of bonus points (ended with an 89 but got a 96).  Go to class and you wont have to read at all, but even if you don't go to class, he posts the lecture slides online.

Brian Lower is a funny guy that is genuinely interested in teaching. He gives out a lot of bonus points, and he's willing to negotiate grades. He cracks a few jokes during lecture, and he's cool with answering questions beforeafter class. This was a really easy class, yet I still learned quite a bit. Lots of videos were used as well.
Dr. Lower is awesome! Great class for all students to take. He gives out a lot bonus and genuinely wants his students to do well in his class.
Recommend to everyone!

Brian is awesome.  He realizes most people don't actually care about the subject but makes it interesting.  He even makes it kind of funny and makes fun of himself.  You have a few online quizzes, 3 online tests, and a large poster symposium. Poster is easy he explains it perfectly.  Very nice guy if you talk to him, would take again.

Brian Lower is one of the best professors at OSU. This class is an easy A. He gives extra credit for showing up to class sometimes and all of the exams are online. We also had to write a scientific journal article that I'm pretty sure everyone got a 100% on. He also gave everyone a 100% on the final as long as they went and saw Jack Hanna speak.
Amazing class!

There are not too many professors I would say are great but Dr. Lower is one of them. I rarely went to class, and I still pulled a B. The exams are very difficult BUT he gives an insane amount of extra credit. He understands that most are taking his class because they have to. I definitely reccommend.

Great class.  Jut go to class and pay attention and you'll be able to tell what's on the exam.  I took his class in the fall so we had a poster project.  It was kind of annoying but I'd rather do that instead of a test.

Probably the easiest class I've taken so far. Lectures are optional but he gives tons of extra credit for attending . One project where you have to make a poster and present at a symposium, but overall it really isn't a lot of work. Both tests are online and open book. I would definitely recommend this GE to non-science majors.

Extra credit for showing up to class, online and open book quizzes and exams, plus all lecture slides posted to carmen. He gets that people are there for an easy A in a Gen Ed science and wants you to get it as much as you do.
He has such an awesome class!! Dr. Lower is able to help you learn a lot and keep you interested at the same time. Definitely recommend it!

Dr. Lower is a fantastic professor and very fair. He keeps the material interesting and relevant. Quizzes and exams are online. Quizzes are really easy and exams can have difficult questions so it is good to look over the notes that he posts on Carmen first. COME TO CLASS because he gives bonus point information! No textbook needed. Great class!
Great Teacher!
Doc Lower's course hit me right in the feels
greatest professor ever!
Cool professor and excellent class!  Prof. Lower was very fair and easy going.  I enjoyed going to class even though he didn't take attendance.  No textbook needed.

If you like having any idea what class expectations are, how to prepare for tests, and not being lied to about assignment requirements, save your sanity and avoid this class. He is also extremely boring and managed to take a subject I care about (I'm working towards a minor in this department) and leave me feeling indifferent and apathetic about it

Dr. Lower is a nice guy and he is definitely fair. However I was DUPED into believing its easy. Its not. The exam questions are all over the place, very hard and strategic, and you only get 1 hour for 45 questions. Take at your own risk!

Brian is everything you could ask for in an instructor. He's fair, smart, funny, and cooperative. He understands that this might not be your favorite class and won't be a huge time commitment for those uninterested. He did a good job of making me, and English major, care about environmental topics. He made it an enjoyable semester.

Online exams and a poster. Attendance bonus. No textbook required. He gave a lot of useful websites and tools to knowledge you what is going on in the world. Basically, he is just trying his best to help you get an A. But I heard that this semester he sets the class harder than last semester.

Best, nicest, and most understanding professor I've had yet. He let's you take all exams online and he boosted all of our grades by 30 points on one of them after he realized some people couldn't download the picture files. I would definitely highly recommend him
He's the man
The class was relatively easy; all tests/quizzes are administered online. Lecture attendance is not mandatory, but you will get some generous bonus points for attending.
Great guy,easy class, easy class. He gives some many extra credit points for attending the class.

His quizzes are simple questions that usually doesn't even have to do about what we are learning. The tests are all online, and he grades the final poster presentation super easy as long as you complete it and have some sort of knowledge on the subject. He often gives out bonus points usually for class attendance. He is very nice and understanding.
Incredibly easy, and interesting. He tries very hard to give out A's. I recommend

Dr. Lower is an extremely nice and reasonable guy, plus knowledgeable about the course materials. You don't really have to go to class 80% of the time but I actually chose to more often than not because I thought his class was really interesting.

Overall, ENR 2100 was pretty easy. Dr. Lower seems to get side tracked a lot and a good amount of his exam questions are from PBS videos. He is very helpful when it comes to uploading lectures online etc. The main thing he is worried about is the short-format article which everyone gets an A on if the effort is made. Overall, pretty good class.

I thought the tests were quite difficult- however, I never attended class and didn't realize that all info comes from class slide- powerpoint till it was too late. That being said I still managed a B even with a 65 on the first two midterm. So the class is somewhat easy- study slides on carmen!!!!

Awesome class, easy, but interesting too. Genuinely cares about his students. Dr. Lower does a great job of incorporating videos, graphics and current topics in his lectures and I definitely recommend his intro to environmental science course.
Doc Low is awesome! The class overall is easy but the exams are definitely tricky. Put some time into studying for the exams and it is a pretty easy A! He gives a ton of bonus points!
Very easy class and everything is on Carmen, you even talk about some interesting topics in class! Highly recommend
Everything is on Carmen. His tests are very easy. I would highly recommend taking this class!

Dr. Lower is the man. All lecture materials online, and he knows students are just taking this for a GEC. Even in spite of this, he manages to provide an engaging experience on lots of interesting topics. Tests aren't hard at all. Take this class!
B Low is the man! He understands most people are taking this class just to get an A. Make minimal effort and you will get an A.
Excellent Professor!  Go to class and study notes = A

This professor doesn't know what it means to use a scientific source.  He claims NewYorkTimes.com is a great source of scientific knowledge and during the first week of class explained to us all why human blood is blue. I expected much more from a Biochemist.  Dr. Lower's the kind of shock and awe professor that gives earth scientists a bad name.

This class was super easy and super boring. He posts notes and lectures online. You never have to go to class. Rec is pointless unless there is a quiz, which is usually just attendance points. He lets you do a huge bonus project at the end of the quarter that can boost your grade a whole letter.
Easy going and laid back. Class is super simple and easy. Nice guy to talk to. Don't buy book. All notes posted online. Uses a lot of videos and graphics to lecture with. I recommend.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and passion for her subject, making her classes both informative and enjoyable. Students appreciate her clear explanations, kindness, and the numerous opportunities for engagement and extra credit. Her courses, whether in-person or online, are described as easy to excel in due to flexible deadlines and quick grading.

Ratings.comment: My favorite professor I have ever met!

She's so great. I loved her class! I didn't need it for my major (I just took it for upper division credit). But it was really informative and enjoyable. She's clearly so passionate about what she does and it shines through in how she lectures. Highly recommend.

I had ENR 3000 online (would not let me select correct course code) and it was a breeze! I learned a lot even though it was online, and Tania was extremely nice and helpful. Easy to get good grades and much of it is self paced with quick grading and flexible deadlines. Definitely would recommend taking her if possible!
She's very good at helping you to understand the material without it being too difficult or technical. Very kind person. She has games during class, lots of extra credit opportunities.

summary_comment: Professor DeBusk is known for her effective and engaging teaching style in ENR 1100, making the class generally easy with minimal outside work and straightforward assignments. She demonstrates a strong commitment to student success through comprehensive lecture presentations and constructive feedback. However, her approach can be firm, requiring students to stay attentive and follow her methods closely.

Ratings.comment: I had professor DeBusk for ENR 1100. Overall, the class was really easy as long as you participated in class. There was rarely outside of class work and the assignments we did have were graded easily. She truly wants you to succeed, and that shows through the lecture presentations and feedback given.
She's caring, but kind of has a "my way or the highway" type approach to the class. Make sure you pay attention or else she'll call you out.

summary_comment: Dr. Zhao excels in making complex material accessible through inspiring guidance and a positive classroom atmosphere, despite a slight accent. His efforts to connect GIS concepts to everyday life enhance understanding, and he provides detailed slides and captions for his lectures. However, the overall organization of the class and Carmen page could be improved.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Zhao was my lab TA for the majority of the semester. He made very difficult assignments seem more feasible by giving inspiring guidance and lightening the mood of a stressful environment. What a sweet and charismatic expert in his field! You will be in great hands with Kai.

Dr. Zhao does about half of the lectures for this class and will show up to lab on at least one occasion. Worked hard to relate GIS concepts to concepts in our lives. Slightly heavy accent but takes the time to caption most of his videos and give very detailed slides. Class as a whole and Carmen page is disorganized, though. Lab is fun.

summary_comment: Dr. Slater is a dedicated and approachable professor known for his efforts to help students understand complex soil science material. While his classes can be challenging, particularly with tough quizzes and a demanding final, students appreciate his willingness to assist and his positive demeanor. Some find his teaching style and Australian accent engaging, while others find the class dry and unhelpful without adequate support from teaching assistants.

Ratings.comment: I took him for Soil Science. The material and quizzes were tough but he did his best to explain it. If you show up, pay attention, take good notes, and try to get a good grade, it shouldn't be too bad. He's a good teacher and if you have to take soil science I would recommend taking him.

Dr. Slater is an awesome man. His soil morphology class is tough and there is quite a bit of material to cover of the semester, but Dr. Slater is more than willing to help you out with and questions. He has field trips that are enjoyable and there are not many grades in the class but if you pay attention you will be fine.

Dr. Slater tries his best to make the information presented understandable to all students. It is not the easiest or most interesting class, but he is a very helpful and kind professor. He is also an adorable older man with an Australian accent.

Professor Slater and his Australian accent are awesome. He understands not many students will be very interested in soil science and makes sure everyone understands the material. He listens to what his students say about the course and changes according to that. He is a great professor I would recommend for taking this class.

Dr. Slater's lab is not too difficult. If you stay and put forth the extra effort, he will basically give you the answer to each lab question and will also tell you if your answer is right or wrong. I was surprised this lab was not more difficult.

Dr. Slater is a very good professor. He works hard to make the class as doable as he can. He is really nice and willing to work with you if you show some effort. His quizzes are unnecessarily hard. His final is also very tough. Overall, his class is a challenge but extremely rewarding for someone interested in agronomy.

Brian Slater is a nice guy, he also knows his stuff. However, he is extremely boring and very unhelpful. If you take his class, you better hope for a good TA like I had. The TA does more of the work than Slater in my opinion.

He was a really nice guy and really funny. The only problem is I got into a class with no TA and he took until week 9 to get us back labs from week 3. And also I am still waiting for my final grade to be posted and he does not exactly follow the syllabus. But overall he did a nice job and I enjoyed him for trying to make it interesting.

Patient and concise lecturer. Dry but so is the material. Doesn't leave much pause for questions during lecture. So speak up! Always answers questions fully. Weekly online quizzes. Use notes! A lot of material to cover. All notes posted online. Don't buy book. Knowledgeable. Has an odd laugh that is adorable. Australian accent nice to listen to.

summary_comment: Professor Slagle's teaching quality is generally low according to student feedback, with many finding her lectures and assignment descriptions confusing and her grading harsh. Despite some positive aspects noted in terms of her enthusiasm and engaging lectures, her lack of teaching training and unclear instructions significantly detract from the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: The set up is very confusing and the description of assignments is very convoluted. It is very difficult to know what you actually have to do and what is being graded. Grading was super harsh and minor details took off major points. Lectures were by other professors. I would not recommend taking this class, especially online.

Dr. Slagle is very excited about her research and wants to help students understand why sociology is important. However, I felt like she has had no training in how to teach. Lecture slides are the weirdest I've seen and very confusing. It was very hard to follow her in class.

I had Professor Slagle for ENR2300 Society & Natural Resources. Being a sociology based course, I was afraid that I would be completely uninterested in the material. Professor Slagle made this the most enjoyable class of my semester! The lectures were engaging and her case studies were related to large, important topics within the environment.

summary_comment: Dr. Basta is generally viewed as an effective instructor, particularly appreciated for his engaging lectures and clear explanations, though some students find his lectures disorganized. Students recommend attending classes regularly, using lecture notes, and seeking help during office hours to succeed. Overall, while his teaching style can be challenging, his approachability and genuine enjoyment of teaching contribute positively to the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Professor Basta cannot teach for the life of him. His lectures are scattered and disorganized and he lacks the ability to convey concepts in a way that is understandable or connective to other topics in the same lecture. He jumps all over the place in lectures and doesn't thoroughly explain difficult topics. Grade is made of basically all tests

Dr. Basta is a true asset to Ohio State.  His lectures are interesting.  He has a great sense of humor, enjoys teaching, and his experience outside of the classroom really helps you apply what your learning.  Show up for class, make note cards of the lectures, and you'll get an A.  He assigned 3 math oriented assignments and 15 half page briefs.

Dr. Basta is an excellent professor.  He seems to genuinely enjoy teaching.  His lectures are interesting.  I would absolutely take him again.  The tests are taken directly from the lecture notes.  There is a little bit of math involved in the class but this is to be expected from a chemistry class. Understand logarithms. He's funny and cares.

Dr. Basta is a great guy. His soil chemistry class is a difficult class, but if you come to class everyday and engage with him during lecture you will be fine. Visit him during office hours if you ever have questions and he will help you out and ease any fear you may have.
Great guy. Very clear and easy to understand.

summary_comment: Dr. Dick's class is challenging and demanding, requiring significant effort and preparation, particularly for the three exams and term paper. While some students found the class interesting and rewarding, others described it as disorganized, difficult to follow during lectures, and excessively stressful. Overall, the teaching style and grading criteria appear to be rigorous and can be frustrating for students.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Dick is a very smart and kind man.  While this class is only graded by 3 exams and a paper, if you listen to lectures, take good notes, and attend office hours before exams you will be fine.  It is definitely a class that requires effort, but it is extremely interesting, and I learned an incredible amount in 7 weeks.

One of the hardest classes I've ever taken. Professor jumps around with little transition and is near impossible to understand in lectures. For an 8 week class gives 3 exams and term paper with little turn around time. Not only was the class itself hard but halfway through professor left for a trip to Africa, leaving lab professor behind to teach

This man hates his students. He had us take 3 long exams for a 7-week session class and also a term paper. Insisted on using the whiteboard for teaching and had useless slides that did not contain any useful information. I really wanted to enjoy this class but he totally ruined the experience for everyone.

The curriculum was disorganized, he taught strictly off of a whiteboard and would put topics he barely or didn't even mention in class on the exams, which were all extended response only. I put more time and effort into this class than any other course I have taken and my grade did not reflect it. Ridiculous expectations for a 7 week class.

In this class unless you meet for private study sessions once a week, you will not pass. His exams are identical to the review sheets but don't be fooled because he is looking for specifics that are not covered in class or book. As the class continues get ready for him to spiral in disorganization. This was the 7 most stressful weeks of my life.
Tough grader Recycled exams so material not necessarily to corresponding chapter you though would be on quiz/exam

The course was difficult because there was a lot of material, so that made studying for the exams difficult.  Definitely a course you have to work for, but satisfying once you accomplish the given tasks.  Stop by for office hours and you'll be in good shape.
Took soil bio. Horrible experience. Horrible prof. Do not take it he hates teaching
Terrible professor. Often changes due dates for assignments and reaaranges syllabus at will. Difficult to understand and unwilling to help students.

summary_comment: The professor is known for delivering an easy, organized, and straightforward online class with pre-recorded lectures and regular quizzes and discussions. While some students find it doable and engaging, others express disappointment due to lack of feedback, reuse of old materials, and minimal instructor engagement.

Ratings.comment: 1 online, pre-recorded lecture per week. A quiz and a discussion post every 2 weeks. This class is easy. If you need to an easy Gen Ed for your degree, definitely take this one.
Received zero feedback on the final paper that I spent days writing! He reuses the same material he was given when he was a student at osu 30 years ago.

Incredibly disappointing. Absolutely zero engagement from the course instructor with canned responses to assignment submissions provided only by TA's. The only content which suggests any hint of originality from course creators include incoherent clip art powerpoint slides with loosely related vocabulary terms thrown in for good measure.

Very easy and straightforward class. For an online class, Dr. Parker is extremely orginized and tech savvy. He makes rural sociology very interesting and doable. Exams are very easy and discussions are graded slightly harder then expected.

summary_comment: Dr. Hovick is highly regarded for his passion and expertise in invasive species, making the subject engaging and informative. Students appreciate his accessibility and commitment to their success, with many recommending the class and expressing a desire to take it again. His teaching style is hands-on and project-driven, with clear expectations and an easy grading curve, though some find the material challenging and the exam questions complex.

Ratings.comment: Mr. Hovick was a great professor. He is extremely passionate about what he is teaching. If you are interesting in invasive species this class is for you. Very informational about Ohio invasive species. He takes attendance by top hat during lecture. 10/10

Honestly, Dr. Hovick is everything I wish I had in a prof my first few years of college. He makes the material digestible for all. He makes himself available for OH, emails, and for ?s after class. Prof is passionate about the material he teaches and cares about student success. Very hands on class, which allows for effective learning. Take 2410!

Start early on the projects and you'll do well even if you failed one of his exams. He has a midterm and final that with 100 points each. Attendance 60. 4 Hours Volunteer 80 and a reflection on it 20. a presentation 170 points and 70 points on quizzes that is due every other week. Easy grader, very understanding and caring. He KNOWS the material

A wonderful professor! Very passionate and excited about the class he teaches, makes invasion biology fun to learn and understand. Definitely opened my eyes to how common and multi-faceted invasions can be. There are a lot of papers and projects, few of which are group projects, so try to start early! A very caring professor. Would have again!

Dr. Hovick's portion of lectures during the course were interesting but the material was very heavy and difficult to understand. The exam questions were long and wordy. They also did not feel as though they represented all of the lectures they were covering evenly.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by kindness and genuine concern for his students' success. He excels as a lecturer and provides numerous opportunities to improve grades, making him a standout educator.

Ratings.comment: Very kind and genuinely cares about his students. Great lecturer and gives lots of opportunities to boost your grade :]

summary_comment: Dr. Jarzyna is an engaging but challenging instructor who covers a lot of material in her lectures, often at a fast pace. Students appreciate her comprehensive content and the recorded lectures, though they find the material difficult to grasp without significant additional study. The tests are noted to be demanding. Overall, while the class is rigorous, many students value Dr. Jarzyna's thorough approach to teaching.

Ratings.comment: I really liked Dr. Jarzyna's portion of the lectures. I found it hard to keep up at times because she does go very fast. She had a lot of content to cover, but instead of simplifying it, she just sped it up. She did record the lectures though, which was nice. Definitely a class that you need to do a lot of outside studying for. Tests are hard.

I really enjoyed having Dr. Jarzyna as a professor! Her portion of the lectures were interesting, but the material was quite difficult to understand. If the material of the course was simplified and the exams were shortened I probably would have enjoyed the class more.

SEI.Subject: EEOB
SEI.Class Name: EEOB Grad Seminar: Current Topics in Quantitative Methods

summary_comment: Dr. Toman is highly regarded for her exceptional organization and clear presentation of material, making even challenging topics accessible and practical. Students find her classes well-structured and supportive, with easy-to-follow lectures and responsive communication. Her passion for the subject matter is evident, and she is known for her patience and willingness to help, contributing to a positive learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Toman is fantastic! This was the best organized online class I've ever taken, and I've taken quite a few. The material didn't initially interest me but she made it applicable. The excel functions we learned also felt very practicable. Very reasonable workload and easy A if you did everything, and she was super nice. One of my fav professors yet

Professor Toman was phenomenal! This was the most organized online class I've ever taken, and I've taken many. As long as you logged in and worked through each week, getting an A was easy. Projects and labs required some work but weren't burdensome, and she was happy to communicate and help.

Took the class online and really enjoyed it. Her lecture videos are easy to follow along with & the course in general was well-organized. She always responded to my emails quickly & found time to meet with me. She's really nice, patient, and helpful with answering questions! She presented the material in a way that is easy to understand.
Very Passionate about the subject will answer you briefly after class and via e mail quickly.  Too bad she is adjunct.  One could learn a lot

summary_comment: The professor delivers high-quality lectures that are both informative and engaging, drawing from extensive field experience. While the class heavily involves group lab reports with limited guidance, the grading is fair and the professor shows flexibility based on class performance. The professor should consider listing ENR 3321 as a prerequisite for this course.

Ratings.comment: Really enjoyed his lectures, he included lots of relevant information from his experiences in the field and kept them engaging. Lots of group lab reports - there's not a lot of guidance for them, but grading is fair and he is flexible based on how the class is doing overall. However, ENR 3321 should be listed as a pre-req for this class.

summary_comment: Professor Packer is known for her rigorous grading standards and lack of accommodations, making the course challenging with a significant emphasis on accurate identification. Despite these strict requirements, she effectively structures the course material, making it accessible even to those without prior knowledge. The primary criticism centers around the discussion boards, which some find less than ideal.

Ratings.comment: She is a tough grader who does not make accommodations and not allow for use of field guides during tests when 50% of our grade is identification. Spelling is also graded on the exams.

Professor Packer was awesome, and I found the class to not be all that bad for someone who had no tree experience prior. Everything was clearly laid out, and the only small gripe I have is I was not a fan of the discussion boards.

summary_comment: Jeremy is highly regarded as a knowledgeable and passionate professor who effectively engages students and prepares them well for assessments. His lectures are described as thought-provoking and interesting, contributing to a productive learning environment. While some students found the class relatively easy, others noted it to be challenging, with mixed feedback on the professor's availability for assistance.

Ratings.comment: Jeremy is a truly fantastic and knowledgeable professor who really does care about the topics he teaches. You can feel the passion when he is lecturing, and his lectures are very thought-provoking. He is a very caring person and makes all discussion feel productive. The class itself is not difficult either, and he prepares you well for tests.

I loved this professor and his class! He was very clearly passionate about the subject and had a very kind manner to his lectures. I looked forward to this class and listening to Dr. Brooks every week.

ENR 2500 is an extremely easy class. Honestly I missed multiple lectures a month and still easily passed with an A. Theres only a few assignments but if you complete them youre good. I felt that we did have some pretty interesting discussions in class too. Overall a knowledgeable and engaging professor.

This professor denied to help a struggling student when asked. This class is the hardest class I have ever take in my many years at OSU and should not be an Intro class. When a student is begging for your help you should definitely help them no matter how late the submission is. partial credit is better than no credit at all.
Fav professor from osu so far. I plan to take one of his other classes! Really knowledgeable and the lectures are interesting. Well prepared for tests and quizzes. Thought-provoking class :)

SEI.Subject: AEDECON
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Environment, Economy, Development and Sustainability

SEI.Class Name: Study at a Foreign Institution: Australia

SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Environment, Economy, Development and Sustainability

summary_comment: Dr. Lal is a highly decorated and renowned soil scientist whose classes are challenging and demanding, often leaving students unprepared for rigorous exams. While some find his lectures engaging and the class rewarding, others describe him as difficult to understand and a poor communicator, recommending avoiding his courses due to his unapproachable nature and high textbook costs.

Ratings.comment: He's an older professor, and his classes are lecture heavy.  He doesn't give exams or tests though, and his homework assignments are super easy.

Dr. Lal is perhaps the most decorated scholar at OSU and perhaps the most well known soil scientist alive today. Being able to take a class with him and present to him is a privilege. This class is partly scientific and partly ideological, and although Dr. Lal is a esteemed scientist, you can tell that hes less familiar with political theory.

This class is hard. Dr. Lal is a challenging professor and can be difficult to understand. His exams are tough and you're never sure what exactly to expect from them. To pass this class you need to make sure you turn in all your weekly lab reports and homeworks or you will never pass.

Avoid at all costs. This professor is simply an embarrassment to the academic community. He represents everything that is wrong with academia today. He strong arms students into taking his soil physics class because he NEVER has enough enrollment. He will also force you to buy HIS textbook for $170.

Old school.  Challenging.  The second day of class he started by calling on students by name, asking about material covered the previous class.  He expected his students to be engaged, which I found refreshing.  His class might not be easy, but it is rewarding.
Professor not interested in teaching at all. Nearly impossible to get in contact with. Overall terrible teacher,avoid if possible.

summary_comment: The professor is known for being a tough grader with unclear criteria for good grades, which makes it challenging to excel without prior experience. Lectures are described as boring and repetitive, focusing on textbook content. Despite some initial intimidation, the professor is noted for being kind and thorough in her coverage of material, making up for the lackluster delivery style.

Ratings.comment: Do not plan to get an A in this class unless you have already worked as an interpretive guide or naturalist. She is a very tough grader yet is unclear on what exactly it takes to get a good grade. The lectures were very boring and consisted of going over fill-in-the-blanks from the textbook. I do not recommend this class or the professor at all.

Professor Rasche was a little intimidating at first, but she is very kind. Her lectures are very thorough even though the subject material can be boring at times. Shes pretty easy on grading. We had an online book, but I never used it because she covered all the material in her lectures.

SEI.Subject: ENR
SEI.Class Name: Foundations for Environmental Communications, Education and Interpretation

SEI.Class Name: Foundations for Environmental Communications, Education and Interpretation

summary_comment: Professor Ellie is an effective instructor who initially presents lectures in a straightforward manner but becomes engaging as the semester progresses. She explains concepts clearly and provides fair, open-note exams. Her classes require only attendance for extra credit and three key exams for grading, with no busywork or additional textbooks needed.

Ratings.comment: Lectures could be a dry in the beginning, but they became interesting later on in the semester. Ellie explains things clearly. No busy work or textbook for this class - only grades are 3 exams that are open note and they are very fair exams. If you go to class you'll do fine. Attendance isn't mandatory, but if you go to class you get extra credit.

summary_comment: The professor is known for being easy-going and accessible, making the course manageable with sufficient effort and offering easy grades. He focuses on qualitative methods and encourages peer teaching and critique, fostering a collaborative learning environment. While the material can be dry, the professor's enthusiasm and fairness, along with ample opportunities for extra credit, make the course approachable and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Very easy-going prof. & accessible to students outside of class despite being so busy. Easy A if you put in the time doing the work. Likes to have students teach material to each other/critique each other's work, encouraging students to get to know each other and hear different perspectives. Focuses more on qualitative than quantitative approaches

Prof. Ludsin is very kind and helpful. The material is a little dry but he is genuinely enthusiastic about it and cracks jokes at times. Don't need the book. Reading over notes should get you a good grade on the exams. Not very difficult, and very fair. Offers quite a few opportunities for extra credit. Would recommend him!
