summary_comment: This professor is consistently rated as one of the worst in terms of teaching quality, characterized by extreme disorganization, poor instruction, and failure to accommodate students' needs. Multiple students have reported such severe issues that the dean intervened, resulting in the professor being removed from the class.

Ratings.comment: The worst professor/person I have ever met. Insanely disorganized, gives horrible instructions for labs, and completely ignores student's disability accommodations. 3 weeks into the semester, we had to go to the DEAN for help. Due to all the problems we have had with him, as of today, he has been removed from the class by the dean. Good riddance.

This class was horrendous. It's not that the material itself is super hard, but the way it's taught makes it seem so much worse. Hattey is extremely disorganized. We would regularly get assignments with entire sentences missing. Administration doesn't care what he does, so beware. If you have any sense of self love, find a different professor!!

In all my time as a student I have never experienced a class as poorly organized as ENR2000. Although the material is fundamental excel and statistics, the lack of communication from both the department and the professor had made this class incredibly anxiety inducing. Please save your money, time, and mental health and take another class.

The worst experience I've had in a class. We had to reach out and get support from the school when we realized if we stuck with Hattey we would not be learning anything. Even when outside people came in and tried helping, nothing really changed except that we had regular assignments. I can't believe I had to pay for this horrible experience.

summary_comment: The professor is known for covering all exam material in lectures and PowerPoints, making attendance and note-taking crucial. While some find the lectures dry and moving too quickly, others appreciate the comprehensive coverage and the opportunity for extra credit through seminar attendance and discussion posts. Overall, the class can be challenging but manageable with consistent effort.

Ratings.comment: All the material for exams was in the lectures and powerpoints. He is super hard to get in touch with and did not reply to my emails and follow up emails for a month. There were a lot of assignments & there is extra credit. Projects were graded very harshly. (I took his class online during AU20 so this review is different than others.)
Basically if you went to the class and went to the review session before the exams you likely got a high B or an A.
Lecture-heavy class, and kind of a tough subject, but if you take notes and pay attention to the lectures you'll be okay.

Not necessarily a bad teacher, just the material from the class itself was so incredibly dry. His powerpoint slides often didn't make sense, and he moves so quickly it's so hard to keep up. Trying to study for tests is impossible bc he says "anything he posts online or mentions in class is fair game" with no other specifications.

Lectures are based on case studies which allows for an easy understanding of the social theories covered. Notes are online but coming to class is very helpful especially because of graded top hat participation.

This is fairly easy. I always referred to it as environmental sociology since it's really anthropologically based as opposed to science. It focuses on understanding the human components of environmental issues and really changes how you think about problems. Lectures are engaging if you're willing to participate. The content isn't hard.
He is very nice.

although lecture could get a tad boring, he gives you all the material you will need for the tests. The tests are very fair and if you study you should have no problem doing well. He offers extra credit for attending seminars outside of class which always helps. The only homework is reading (decently dry but do it for the test) and discussion posts

His exams are very detailed and challenging. He is a good teacher, if you can understand his speech impediment, and he encourages participation. Lots of dry and boring reading assignments. His power points aren't specific so you have to take detailed notes to study. Lots of online discussion required. Not super challenging or work heavy but boring.
He's incredibly approachable.  ENR 2300 was my favorite class in undergrad.  I introduced myself the first day and he remembered my name and made an effort to reach out.  Great guy, great professor.

The readings are too long and pointless and he tests on little random details in them.   I attempted to contact through class email 4 times about grade discrepancies throughout the semester, and never received a response.  Should be a guaranteed A, but he tosses in both trickbasically opinion Q's on the tests to lower course grades.
Worst professor I've ever had, no help at all and has his TA's do everything. TA's were nt any help either.

Not a bad teacher. Nice guy, willing to discuss with you and answer questions. Gave us readings and discussed them in class but I sometimes felt like there wasn't a point to the class. It was almost philosophical and covered more theories than I would've liked, but it's a fairly easy class. Show up and review before tests and you should be good.

Good professor in general, however he is still has some room for improvement. Class discussions are really nice. However, we always run out of time. Great person, but teaching methodology could be better. I think he is kind of cute.
As long as you pay attention and take notes, as well as participate, you will be fine with this instructor. The assignments are much harder than the tests. Workload is manageable.

He moves through material too fast and since he doesn't put the power points online and doesn't allow computers so you have to be a really fast writer..like really really fast. I personally prefer to take hand written notes and it was hard to keep up especially with such long classes now that we are on semesters. not the worst but far from the best

I had Dr. Toman for 203 as well and I thoroughly enjoyed his classes. He has a bit of a speech impediment, but if you're the least bit attentive it's not hard to get through. He knows all of the material very well and is interested in teaching it as well as helping you learn it if you have any questions. Not the easiest grader, but not the hardest.

Not a particularlly good professor, but not the worst either.  Can be rather monotone and repetitive.  Understands his subject well and conveys the material in a useful manner. You need to do weekly papers for recitation (1/2 page or so), which can be annoying, but if you pick articles of topics that interest you it can be pretty fun.

His questions are very vague,even when you  bring the article to him to defend your answer he turns it around.He is difficult to understand due to his speech impediment and talking too fast. Spent way too much time on the Pacific NW,& the fishing game. Recitation req a 1-2 page paper every week with a quiz at the beginning that was tough.

summary_comment: Professor Hitzhusen is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, genuinely caring about his students, and fostering an engaging learning environment. Students consistently praise his passion for the subject matter, his willingness to connect with students individually, and his ability to make complex topics accessible and thought-provoking. His courses are described as challenging yet rewarding, with a strong emphasis on reading and discussions that promote critical thinking and open-mindedness.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Hitzhusen was an amazing teacher. He clearly cares about his students and his class material. He is very easy to talk to and is understanding. There is a final paper and exam, but I nwould recommend this course
Best professor ive ever had

One of a few profs I've had who GENUINELY cares deeply about the students and got to know us individually. Learned so much but just sat in class and listened -- didn't find myself taking notes during lecture. One page-long homework due weekly for discussion. Thought-provoking but easy and stress-free. TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! So much respect for Greg.

His class isnt too hard; as long as you keep up with the readings then the writing wont be hard. Dont bs this class! Discussions are awesome and always thought provoking,and the lectures are really interesting. Dr Hitzhusen is one of the best professors Ive had. He has lots of interesting stories and is always more than willing to talk with you

An inspirational professor who is one of those once in a lifetime professors. I took his class twice because he is just that amazing. First met him at Stone Lab and he was so genuine and inspirational that when I heard he was teaching a course, I had to join it. He could make the most subject turn into the best.

Maybe the kindest teacher I've ever had. If you let it, his class will teach you how to have constructive conversations about contentious topics, enjoy other classes more, and think more open-mindedly. He's so passionate that you can't help but get invested in what he's saying. Fair warning: he loves to read and loves to make students read, too.

Greg is one of the best professors I've ever had. He's incredibly passionate about the topic of this class and it makes the class more interesting. He's currently writing his own textbook that we read. There are a lot of readings and weekly synopses, but it's worth it to take this class.

He is one of the most inspirational professors at this university. He wants you to succeed and he wants to open your mind up to all of these different perspectives. If you do not like classes where your opinions are challenged, don't take it. The class is a lot of work, but you feel as if you're actually learning something.100% recommend this class

The best way to summarize Mr. Hitzhusen is that he is simply a wonderful person. He lives to help others, and his teaching shows it. By far one of the best, if not THE best professor I have ever had here at OSU. The class was sometimes a bore, but he never was. He knows what he is talking about.

-Good class to improve important writing skills Interesting stories and concepts taught -Really wants to help students -A few classes seemed unnecessary or too long -Takes up a lot of time, but worth it if you have a hard working group -Glad I took this class and had him as a professor -kind and helpful person

By far the best professor I have had at OSU. His class is a pain, but I walked away knowing I learned a lot and can speak confidently about my experiences. He is genuinely interested in building tangible writing skills amongst ENR students. A skill many of us lack...love this man!! So intelligent.

summary_comment: The professor is consistently rated as poor across multiple student comments, described as spiteful, rude, and unhelpful. Students advise strongly to avoid her classes due to her negative attitude, poor communication skills, and perceived disinterest in engaging with students.

Ratings.comment: Avoid at all cost. Spiteful, rude, treats upperclassmen like children. Allegedly distributed exams of different difficulty based on her preference. Worst experience I have had at Ohio State.
She is HORRIBLE. Try to avoid any class she is teaching at all costs. She is extremely stuck up and not helpful at all. She is intelligent but not the teaching type, as she just reads off slides.

This teacher will not only make an interesting course extremely boring , she will also treat you like you are in class for her sake. She does not communicate well and has a very negative attitude. She knows her material but must be more interested in her own research, rather than getting hands on with her students. AVOID CLASS IF POSSIBLE.

summary_comment: Ajay is highly regarded for his availability and clear grading criteria, making him an effective instructor despite the large class size. Many students appreciate his willingness to help and the opportunities for one-on-one feedback. However, some find his lectures unengaging and the material repetitive, with a few noting that the class can feel monotonous and less effective without active participation.

Ratings.comment: Ajay is great! I don't quite understand some of the comments from other students. The class is large (more than 100) and so it is lecture heavy. But he would always make time before or after class and the TAs and Ajay had office hours every week. The grading criteria was clear.
Fantastic exerience. I would totally take his class again!
He is very helpful in his feedback and cares about students. He was always in his office during office hours and once, when I wasn't able to make it during his office hours he made time for me.

This class is a 100+ student and so is very heavy on lecture. However, there were opportunities to work in small groups to discuss readings and do activities. He also allowed us to work one-on-one with him to improve our papers.
The Organization of lectures is not great, but the general concepts of the class were interesting, and he promoted spontaneous in-class discussions which were pretty interesting.

Not a good lecturer and attendance policy is ridiculous (5% loss if miss 2 lectures). Very unhelpful and essentially makes a dull class even more unnecessarily boring. Not necessarily hard but a lot of 'busy work' and repetition on things learned in other classes. Would avoid if possible.

This guy is probably really great outside of class but he is unprepared, unenthusiastic and has given a disappointing attempt to teach a class with much potential. Tests are mostly essay and very few multiple choice-graded fairly. I've only done well by memorizing terms and relying heavily on the readings. Attendance is mandatory but not beneficial

The most boring lectures you will ever encounter. It's like a brick wall talking in monotone. Readings are incredibly boring and dull. Standard just read an write assignments. Very little examples in class. You have to show up because the lectures he posts online are just rhetorical questions.

Lectures are interactive with clicker questions to start group discussions. You can tell he enjoys the discussions and wants to help his students expand their knowledge and succeed. You have to put in the work for exams but having a great professor with personality makes it easier. I was beyond excited when I got him for another class.

Had trouble comprehending his own slides, poor lecturer. Doesn't allow computers in class. Mandatory clicker attendance every day. Attempts to make a 170 person lecture into a discussion (doesn't work). Put our class into groups of 9-10 and expected those groups to work together on 6-8 page papers. Utilizes carmen a lot with "discussion posts."

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their effective teaching methods, which include a balanced mix of indoor and outdoor lab work along with engaging lectures. Students find her knowledgeable and enthusiastic, which helps to激发学习兴趣。她总是乐于提供帮助，并且教学效果显著。

Ratings.comment: Great instructor, learned a lot. Great mix of indoor lab work, lecture, and outdoor lab/field work.
Great teacher!! Loved her lectures and loved the labs with her! Pay attention and you will learn all you need to. She gives great advice and is always willing to help.
She is brilliant. She is excited about what she teaches.  She gets you excited about what she teaches.  She teaches it well.  She is very attractive.

summary_comment: Professor Heywood excels in engaging students with his wit and passion for the subject, often pushing grades up significantly. However, his teaching style can be confusing, requiring students to seek clarification and self-motivation. Reviews are mixed, with some finding his classes straightforward and easy due to extensive online resources, while others criticize his unclear communication and outdated material, suggesting a generally poor teaching experience.

Ratings.comment: I loved the class. He was witty and passionate about the subject.Pushed my grade up from B+ to A- without me asking.Learned a lot and had no problem following the material. All power points and assignment posted online. Good power point layout. A lot of studying needed since terms are similar. Test relates to in class discussion, so don't skip all.

Prof. Heywood sufferes from a complete inability to communicate what it is he wants. While he is a adequate public speaker he is not an effective teacher. He does not understand this distinction. YOU MUST PRESS HIM FOR SPECIFIC DEADLINES AND SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH DEADLINE. He will not bother to clarify otherwise.

Prof Heywood is one of the worst professors I have ever had. Very unclear what he wants written work returned with weak and D scribbled all over it Tai Chi at noon is more important than helping a student ALmost half the class fails the Midterm(s) Many get C's NOT HELPFUL DESPITE TRYING TO SEE HIM BEFORE OR AFTER CLASS
Useless professor. Has no interest in teaching at all. He was just promoted which blows my mind. Avoid this teacher and the entire ENR department if at all possible!

This is the most useless/boring class I have ever taken in all of college. He is more concerned about telling you about all of his studies then actually teaching you something. His power points and style of teaching is unorganized and extremely unhelpful. The only positive thing about the class is the exams are online.

Straightforward,but unclear at the same time. Says things like you already know what he is talking about, but he doesnt explain at all! As far as the group project that is worth alot of your grade-goodluck b/c he doesn't give clear or thorough guidelines of what's expected.

I have had Heywood twice now. He is a worthless professor. His material is out dated and he does nothing new. He recycles the same ole stuff year after year. It is obvious he is tired of teaching, he has no interest in the students at all. I would have taken a different class but it was required.
Annoying laugh, but everything is online, notes, midterms... so its really easy. Required recitation is pointless but this class is 0 work.

This was a class that I was very much looking forward to. I thought this (planning) may be something I may have even wanted to pursue as a career. Unfortunately, OSU got the wrong person to teach this course and made it completely uninteresting. I guess I'll never really know how interesting the subject could've been.

In my opinion, he did an absolutely horrible job of teaching 640. He would talk on and on about absolutely nothing at all. Also, his tests were ridiculous and you really had no idea what to expect on them. The final project (40% of final grade) was graded very harshly without him really ever telling you what he wanted from you. Would not recommend.
his tests are hard and he didn't do a very good job explaining what he wanted in our project that is worth 40% of your grade.
Really knows how to make an interesting subject boring. The recitation assignments are worded so as to lead you to the answer he wants, not the truth.

I took this class over the summer in five weeks instead of ten.  That was probably my mistake.  Sitting there for two hours was so painful.  I suggest bringing other homework and working on it while he teaches.  I couldn't stay awake.
The class is boring, what lots of intresting information

This class was definitely easy. Exams are very straightforward, no final, and you have an easy assignment due every week. The only down side is that he's pretty boring and the class is hard to stay awake in, if you can motivate yourself to go.

He is well organized and the content is easily learned.  Its not difficult to understand, but there is a decent amount of material.  However, if you study the slides he gives you the 3 exams (no final) are not difficult.  There is an assignment due each fri in recitation are not difficult.  Heywood is really nice too :)

summary_comment: Professor BCA is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and willingness to assist students outside of class, making it possible for students to learn extensively provided they dedicate sufficient time to the course.

Ratings.comment: BCA.  You'll learn a lot in this class if you're willing to put in the time.  Very considerate prof. and always willing to work with you outside of class.

summary_comment: Professor Bull is an effective and passionate educator who emphasizes memorization and review sessions for her exams, which consist primarily of short-answer and fill-in-the-blank questions. With a strong background as an Assistant Attorney General, she brings real-world experience to the classroom, making the subject matter engaging and comprehensive. Students appreciate her supportive nature and find her classes both informative and manageable.

Ratings.comment: The only grades in the course are 3 exams which are mainly short answer/fill-in-the-blank with only a couple true/false and multiple choice questions. Attendance is not mandatory, just show up for the review session before each exam and you will pass.

Professor Bull is a great teacher.  She really enjoys it.  Her class isn't too difficult.  If you show up, take good notes and make note cards directly from the lecture slides, then memorize, you'll do fine.  Her tests are not too hard.  However, you will learn a lot about environmental laws. Be comfortable with knowing case laws and statutes.

Prof Bull brings a wealth of background and experience as an Asst Attny General. She is passionate about teaching and it shows. She has a great personal concern for her students success and an understanding of the material that goes beyond the curriculum. Guest lecturers were pertinent and fascinating. Loved her classes. Highly recommended!

Professor Bull is fantastic.  At first you might be worried because she can seem disorganized and a bit spacey, but if you are like me you will come to love her as an instructor.  She is extremely nice and helpful to students, and the tests are easy - just write down what she says on review day. You learn a lot even though it's an easy class.

summary_comment: This professor excels at structuring online classes with clear and accessible lectures, making it easy for students to follow along and take notes. While her exams can be challenging, she offers extensive extra credit opportunities, and her feedback is valuable. Students find her helpful and the course material engaging, especially her lectures.

Ratings.comment: She set up the online class and carmen so that it was very easy to follow along and know exactly what lectures you had to do for that week. The lectures were easy to follow along and take notes, however the exams could be a little harder. I got B's on all of the exams, but still got an A in the class because she offers EXT credit. Would recommend!

Love her and this class! The lectures are super basic but the tests are a lot harder. She offers extra credit which is nice. The tests are pretty hard for the basic lectures. They're all videos or PDFs. She is super helpful and gives great feedback. There is also a poster project.

Very nice, for an 8-week summer term class what was expected of you is reasonable. Usually an hour or so of lecture per week, discussion board, and quiz or exam. The course material was interesting. The lectures given by her were my favorite, there's another lecturer that's a tad boring and hard to hear though. Overall, highly recommended.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded as an advisor, providing valuable guidance and care. However, students find her survey classes somewhat lacking in quality and relevance, often feeling they could be delivered online. Reviews also highlight issues with her teaching methods and organizational skills, with some advising students to seek alternative resources or advisors.

Ratings.comment: She teaches a survey class and it kind of felt like it could just be done online but there were a lot of people that came to talk to our class. She is my advisor and gives great advice and cares a lot.

She was able to answer any question that I had in relation to advising. Class was easy, and if you don't know anything about college it is helpful. If you know what you are doing or have any common sense it is kind of a pointless class.

She teaches survey for the SENR. She is a terrible advisor, has no idea what she is doing. She messed up my freshman year by putting me in the wrong math class. She makes you sign in to every class. She "teaches" survey like it is important, it's pointless but you have to go. If she is your advisor, change as quick as possible.

This woman does not know how to teach. I've had her for my orientation class and she was on my study abroad trip. Avoid her like the plague. She is also an academic adviser. She doesn't seem to know what she is doing, trade her in as soon as you can! She is also annoying and is extremely slow to post grades. Very disorganized.

summary_comment: Dr. Hamilton is an effective and flexible professor who maintains high teaching standards even during challenging times like the pandemic. He communicates clearly and enthusiastically, though the material can sometimes feel dry, especially in early morning classes. Students appreciate his responsiveness and flexibility, despite the demanding workload, including extensive paper writing and comprehensive exams.

Ratings.comment: Easy quizzes and short reflections throughout the semester. Took this class with him during the pandemic (so maybe that changed some things idk), and he was extremely flexible and willing to work with students. He responds to most emails extremely fast!

Dr. Hamilton is a really interesting guy on top of being a great professor. He conveys information clearly and with enthusiasm. I had his class at 8am so sometimes it felt dry, but that's not his fault! You write a lot of papers on one environmental issue so be ready to choose a topic and stick with it for a while. Exams are harder than expected.

Dr. Hamilton loves what he does and you can tell he really cares about it. The subject of policy can just be dry and it is hard to go off the slides. It isn't really his fault that the class is that way. You have to write a policy brief that is based on all the papers you write during the whole course. Pick a subject that isn't too narrow for it!

summary_comment: This professor is consistently rated as one of the worst due to his inability to explain concepts clearly, frequent stutters, and mathematical errors. Students find his lectures unhelpful and struggle significantly, often needing to teach themselves the material. His grading is also perceived as extremely tough, and he becomes agitated when students seek assistance.

Ratings.comment: The WORST professor I've ever had. Second time having him. He cant explain, stutters, makes constant mathmatical mistakes, gets aggrivated when others ask for help or assistance, and grades very tough. You will 100% have to teach yourself. Every student in my class was struggling immensly both times. My advice is to steer clear

SEI.Subject: VETPREV
SEI.Class Name: Foodborne Diseases, Food Animal Production Systems, and Food Safety
